Akira Kurosawa's RAN

Thursday July 8, 7:30 pm
Cinestudio

Description: (Japan, 1985) Directed by: Akira Kurosawa. Screenplay by Akira Kurosawa and Hisami Kurosawa, based on William Shakespeare's King Lear. Cinematographer: Takao Saito Cast: Tatsuya Nakadai, Akira Terao, Jinpachi Nezu, Daisuke Ryu.

The movie event of the summer is the vivid new restored 35mm widescreen print of Kurosaswa's awe-inspiring epic, Ran. Inspired by Shakespeare's King Lear, the 27th film of the then-75-year-old master is a cinematic spectacle that only reveals its greatness on the big screen. Like Lear, Kurosawa's aging warlord fights off chaos, pleading "I have tales to tell, forgiveness to ask." In hopes of creating peace after a lifetime of waging war, he splits his kingdom between three sons - two of whom are plotting betrayal. Kurosawa's genius is in making Tatsuya Nakadai's descent into madness and irrelevance just as thrilling to watch as epic battles and burning castles.

"Among the most thrilling movie experiences a viewer can have!" - Terrence Rafferty, New York Times.

"Kurosawa's late-period masterpiece is one of the most exquisite spectacles ever made...passionate, somber, and profound." - New York magazine.

160 min.
